questions.question: What does the fulfillment of the struggle of independence mainly refer to?
questions.answer: Achievement of freedom and nation-building

questions.question: Which event finally fulfilled the long freedom struggle?
questions.answer: Independence of India

questions.question: Which body was responsible for framing the Constitution of India?
questions.answer: Constituent Assembly

questions.question: Who chaired the Drafting Committee of the Constitution?
questions.answer: Dr. B.R. Ambedkar

questions.question: When was the Constitution of India adopted?
questions.answer: 26 November 1949

questions.question: What is the main objective of the Indian Constitution?
questions.answer: Establish democracy and justice

questions.question: Which values are emphasized in the Preamble?
questions.answer: Liberty, Equality, Fraternity

questions.question: Which system of government did India adopt?
questions.answer: Parliamentary

questions.question: India became a republic on ____.
questions.answer: 26 January 1950

questions.question: Who was the first President of the Constituent Assembly?
questions.answer: Rajendra Prasad

questions.question: What is meant by fulfillment of the struggle of independence?
questions.answer: It refers to achieving independence and establishing a democratic nation.

questions.question: What was the role of the Constituent Assembly?
questions.answer: It framed the Constitution of independent India.

questions.question: Who was Dr. B.R. Ambedkar?
questions.answer: He was the Chairman of the Drafting Committee of the Indian Constitution.

questions.question: What is the importance of the Indian Constitution?
questions.answer: It provides the framework for governance and protects citizens' rights.

questions.question: Why is 26 January 1950 important?
questions.answer: On this day India became a republic and the Constitution came into force.
